DOC.HEAD: Hot-Air Balloons With Peace Slogans at Brandenburg Gate
With AM-East Germany
DOC.TEXT: Two hot-air balloons bearing peace slogans were anchored Wednesday in front of the Brandenburg Gate as a sign of friendship. Dozens of people looked on as a joint French-West German team began anchoring the mammoth, brightly colored balloons. The team had expected officials would turn down their request to anchor the balloons on East Berlin territory, but the Foreign Ministry granted permission, the official ADN news agency said. ``We have the luck to experience this new epoch of peace and understanding,'' said Jean-Marc Culas, the head of the team. ``We simply wanted to be there and bring our message with the balloons to everyone.'' It was yet another sign of relaxed rules along the once-dreaded Berlin Wall, where dozens of souvenir-seekers continue hack away on the western side gathering souvenirs. West Berlin police said they had taken into custody two Americans and a West Berlin man who had broken out seven sections of the wall, each measuring 8 feet high by more than 3 feet wide. The unidentified men apparently wanted to sell the sections as souvenirs and had loaded five of them onto a truck before they were caught, police said. Police said they were cited for theft and released.
